p: Our phylogeographic study showed how HIV-1 subtype B spread mainly from inland regions to coastal cities, and from El Ejido to the city of Almer√≠a in east Andalusia. This was perhaps motivated primarily by a higher proportion of patients infected with HIV-1 to these areas while visiting coastal areas and, secondly, also by many migrants (25/55, 45%) who concentrate in El Ejido, where approximately a third of patients are migrants (25/66, 38%; S2 Fig) who come mainly from North Africa (15/25, 60%) (data not shown). For a number of years, this area has been a gateway to African migration into Spain and Europe, and has contributed to numerous transmission events.
